intro: Vangueriopsis leucodermis, commonly known as the white-skinned vangueriopsis, is a species of flowering plant in the family Fabaceae. It is native to certain regions of South America, particularly in Brazil. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, clustered leaves. Its flowers are typically pale yellow or white, and it produces legume pods containing seeds. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
